title: Pride Of Britain Awards: Dua Lipa makes a bold statement in thigh-skimming black minidress
text:
She's used to making the stage her own, but on Monday night the spotlight shone for host of others as Dua Lipa attended the annual Pride Of Britain Awards.

The singer, 24, commanded attention in a thigh-skimming black minidress as she greeted award winners backstage at London's Grosvenor House Hotel.

With pinched shoulders and a plunging front, the outfit ensured Dua, 24, caught the eye while posing for photos with Child of Courage recipient Ben Hedger and his mother Lauren.

Here she comes: She's used to making the stage her own, but on Monday night the spotlight shone for host of others as Dua Lipa attended the annual Pride Of Britain Awards

The English star added to her look with a pair of black tights, while grey stiletto heels rounded things off.

Drawing further attention to her general look, she opted for a distinctive two-tone hairstyle and rich, generously applied make-up.

Dua was without boyfriend Anwar Hadid as she rubbed shoulders with guests including Cheryl and Simon Cowell at the event.

Strike a pose: The singer, 24, commanded attention in a thigh-skimming black minidress as she greeted award winners backstage at London's Grosvenor House Hotel

The couple first sparked serious romance rumors when they were seen packing on the PDA while attending a UK music festival over Fourth of July weekend.

TMZ reported that 'things really started to snowball around early June when Hadid found out Lipa, who's friends with his sister Gigi, had split from her beau and 'reached out for a date.'

The couple have been very open with heir newfound love and have been photographed together a number of times in the proceeding months.

Say cheese: With pinched shoulders and a plunging front, the outfit ensured Dua, 24, caught the eye while posing for photos with Child of Courage recipient Ben Hedger

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars came together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Host Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started.

'In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
